data: TM CMV Immune Globulin (Lung Transplant) (Module)
Blood Products
Blood Product Fact Sheet
Refer to Adjusted Body Weight Calculator to calculate ideal & dosing weight
Round CMV Ig order (dosing) down to nearest 2.5 g to avoid wastage
Prophylaxis
CMV positive donor with negative recipient
Prophylaxis: Initial dose is 0.15 g/kg on Day 0 then every 2 weeks for 4 doses
Administer - CMV Immune Globulin Transfusion
Routine, g, IV, Administer over: Refer to Fact Sheet/Product Monograph, once, Maximum rate 75 mL/h. Administer via an infusion device using an in-line filter (15 micron), T;N
Administer - CMV Immune Globulin Transfusion
Routine, g, IV, Administer over: Refer to Fact Sheet/Product Monograph, q2week, for 4 doses or times, Maximum rate 75 mL/h. Administer via an infusion device using an in-line filter (15 micron), T;N
Maintenance dose is 0.1 g/kg every 4 weeks for 2 doses
Administer - CMV Immune Globulin Transfusion
Routine, g, IV, Administer over: Refer to Fact Sheet/Product Monograph, q4week, for 2 doses or times, Maximum rate 75 mL/h. Administer via an infusion device using an in-line filter (15 micron), T;N
Treatment
Primary CMV infection (CMV donor and recipient negative)  CMV infection (CMV donor positive / recipient negative)  Treatment of severe CMV infection (CMV recipient positive)
Treatment: Initial dose is 0.15 g/kg twice weekly for 2 weeks; then weekly for 2 weeks
Administer - CMV Immune Globulin Transfusion

Routine, g, IV, Administer over: Refer to Fact Sheet/Product Monograph, q96h interval, for 4 doses or times, Maximum rate 75 mL/h. Administer via an infusion device using an in-line filter (15 micron), T;N
Administer - CMV Immune Globulin Transfusion
Routine, g, IV, Administer over: Refer to Fact Sheet/Product Monograph, qweek, for 2 doses or times, Maximum rate 75 mL/h. Administer via an infusion device using an in-line filter (15 micron), T;N
Maintenance dose is 0.1 g/kg monthly for 3 months
Administer - CMV Immune Globulin Transfusion
Routine, g, IV, Administer over: Refer to Fact Sheet/Product Monograph, q4week, for 3 doses or times, Maximum rate 75 mL/h. Administer via an infusion device using an in-line filter (15 micron), T;N
Communication Order

If the patient exhibits signs or symptoms of a Transfusion Reaction, Print Transfusion Reaction Form from FormFast and follow your transfusion reaction guideline.  Notify provider of the transfusion reaction to obtain further care instructions.
